Hero.title: Glitch Lab
Hero.subtitle: GlitchLab is a living lab dedicated to the participatory design of technologies. It was created in collaboration with the Equal Opportunities Office of Università della Svizzera italiana (USI) and is hosted by LUXIA – the User Experience, Interaction and Accessibility lab.

howItWorks.title: How does it work?
howItWorks.description: Every two weeks, we hold free, flexible 2-hour workshops where participants collaborate with the research team through design, prototyping, and evaluation activities. Participation is open and flexible — attendees can choose which sessions to join without any attendance requirements.

themes.title: Themes
items: Creative and conscious use of technology for learning
Ethical and inclusive design, focused on values and diversity

whyParticipate.title: Why participate?
whyParticipate.description: GlitchLab offers direct mentoring with researchers, values young perspectives, and fosters creativity, critical thinking, and inclusion.

Footer.description: Empowering learning through interactive workshops and hands-on experiences.
Footer.address:
Laboratory of User Experience, Interaction & Accessibility
Faculty of Informatics
Università della Svizzera italiana
Via la Santa 1, 6962 Viganello

items.question: What is GlitchLab?
items.answer: GlitchLab is a living lab focused on participatory design of technologies with and for girls and boys. It was created in collaboration with the University’s Equal Opportunities Service and takes place within LUXIA, the User Experience, Interaction and Accessibility Laboratory, led by Prof. Monica Landoni.

items.question: Who can participate in GlitchLab?
items.answer: The project is specifically aimed at middle school girls, with the goal of actively involving them in creating and reflecting on current and future technologies.

items.question: What is a living lab?
items.answer: A living lab is an open, experimental space where research and innovation develop through the direct involvement of the people for whom technologies are designed. GlitchLab uses this model to foster collaboration and exchange.

items.question: How does GlitchLab work?
items.answer: Workshops are held every two weeks in a dedicated university space, lasting about two hours each. During these sessions, participants collaborate with the research team on activities such as critical design, prototyping, collective ideation, and evaluation of existing technologies.

items.question: Do I have to attend all the workshops?
items.answer: No, participation is free, open, and flexible. There is no fixed or mandatory path: you can freely choose which workshops to attend, even occasionally, by booking through an online calendar.

items.question: How are participants involved?
items.answer: Participants are actively engaged in all stages of the creative and research process: they take part in ideation, prototyping, and testing of new technologies. In this way, they become true designers and researchers, contributing their ideas, feedback, and skills to the development of innovative and inclusive tools.

items.question: What role does mentoring play in GlitchLab?
items.answer: Mentoring is a key aspect: participants work closely with the research team, who guide and support them throughout the creative process, encouraging mutual learning and idea exchange.

items.question: What are the main goals of GlitchLab?
items.answer:
• Promote youth participation in technology design processes.

• Value the perspectives of girls and boys in academic research.

• Support gender equity and diversity in scientific and technological fields.

• Provide mentoring experiences between young participants and researchers.

• Foster critical thinking, creativity, collaboration, and awareness.

items.question: Is GlitchLab inspired by other projects?
items.answer: Yes, it draws inspiration from successful international initiatives like KidsTeam, a network of U.S. universities where children collaborate with researchers and designers to create digital tools.

About.title: What is GlitchLab?
About.description:
GlitchLab is a living lab dedicated to the participatory design of technologies. It was created in collaboration with the Equal Opportunities Office of Università della Svizzera italiana (USI) and is hosted by LUXIA – the User Experience, Interaction and Accessibility lab.

Here, middle school students become active creators and critical thinkers about technology, learning to use it consciously and thoughtfully.
